transcript: but modernization actually brought communication and a whole new material in the form of telephone wire rural to urban migration meant that newfound industrial materials natural grasses so here you can see the change from use starting to use these pieces date back from the ' 40s to the late ' 50s which came from a squatter camp outside durban i got the opportunity to start working with this community at that point and started developing really and mentoring them in terms of the design and the project soon grew from five to fifty weavers in about a year and not only to supply the materials on on bobbins but to produce to our color specifications away from the ethnic a little bit more contemporary so i developed a whole range around mass produced range higher end decor market that could be exported and also service our local market we started experimenting as you can see in terms of shapes and it 's and they come on a weekly basis to and it 's supporting and the rest says it all
